alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Monroe (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 23 at 8:36AM EST until February 23 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Buffalo NY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New York... Genesee River At Avon affecting Livingston and Monroe Counties. For the Genesee River...including Avon and South Rochester...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Genesee River At Avon. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 33.0 feet, Flood stage, river overflows at many areas from Geneseo to Scottsville, but mainly in agricultural lands with little damage to structures. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 32.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 33.2 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 33.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.3 feet on 12/31/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 700 PM EST.
